xyz.acygn.mokapot.util

Class ArrayWrapper<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<T>
        • xyz.acygn.mokapot.util.ArrayWrapper<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The component type of the array.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterable<T>, Collection<T>, List<T>

    public class ArrayWrapper<T>
extends AbstractList<T>
implements Serializable
    A class that acts, in most respects, identically to a Java array. However, being an actual class, rather than a primitive, makes it possible to inherit from, intercept methods of, etc..
    Author:
    Alex Smith
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArrayWrapper

        public ArrayWrapper(int length,
                    Class<T> componentType)
        Creates a new array wrapper, with the given length and type.
        Parameters:
        length - The number of elements in the wrapped array. This cannot be changed after the array wrapper is created.
        componentType - The component type of the created array.

      • ArrayWrapper

        protected ArrayWrapper(Object storage,
                       Class<T> componentType)
        Creates a new wrapper, with the given component type and storage array. This can be used to create two ArrayWrappers with the same storage but different component types.
        Parameters:
        storage - The storage array.
        componentType - The component type of this wrapper, which can potentially be a superclass of that of the storage array (because Java arrays are covariant).

      • ArrayWrapper

        public ArrayWrapper(ArrayWrapper<? extends T> existingWrapper,
                    Class<T> componentType)
        Creates a new array, by casting an existing array wrapper to a new wrapper whose component type is a supertype of the existing array wrapper's component type. Note that doing this may potentially cause ArrayStoreExceptions when an attempt is made to write an object of the wrong type into the resulting cast array (Java arrays are covariant, and mutable covariant collections are not fully type-safe.)
        Parameters:
        existingWrapper - The wrapper to cast.
        componentType - The new component type to use for the new wrapper.

    • Method Detail

      • asArray

        public Object asArray()
        Returns the array wrapped by this array wrapper. Note that unlike AbstractCollection#toArray, the resulting array is shared with the internals of the array wrapper; modifying the returned array directly, and modifying the array via the array wrapper, will both change both the returned array and the wrapped array.

        The array is returned as an Object, because not every array type can be cast to Object[] (which is what T[] would erase to).

        Returns:
        The array wrapped by this array wrapper.

      • get

        public T get(int i)
        Returns the element at the given array index. Note that an array can (and does by default) contain null elements.
        Specified by:
        get in interface List<T>
        Specified by:
        get in class AbstractList<T>
        Parameters:
        i - The index at which to retrieve the element.
        Returns:
        The element at the given index.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is negative, or greater than or equal to the number of elements in the array

        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The number of elements that can be stored in the array.

      • set

        public T set(int i,
             T e)
        Changes an element of this array.
        Specified by:
        set in interface List<T>
        Overrides:
        set in class AbstractList<T>
        Parameters:
        i - The array index to change.
        e - The new element at that index.
        Returns:
        The old value of the element that was changed.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If i is negative, or greater than or equal to the size of the array.
        ArrayStoreException - If this array wrapper was produced via casting it from an array wrapper whose component type was a subtype of T, and e is not an instance of that subtype
